cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 305 miles SSE of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move northwest, cross the northern Yucatan Peninsula late Monday, then turn north-north-eastward across the central Gulf of Mexico toward the central Gulf Coast mid-week, eventually weakening inland over the southeast-U.S.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Gulf Coast (likely Louisiana/Mississippi coast) after an earlier landfall on the northern Yucatan Peninsula

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch/Warning from Tulum to Rio Lagartos, Mexico including Cozumel; Tropical-Storm Warning for Pinar del Rio, Cuba
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Tulum to Rio Lagartos, Mexico including Cozumel; Tropical-Storm Warning for Pinar del Rio, Cuba
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Yucatan Peninsula, western Cuba, and the U.S. central Gulf Coast from Louisiana eastward to Alabama
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None (no Virginia sites listed in NHC wind-probability table)
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely (current guidance shows <2 inches for Virginia area)
weather_observation.wind: Only brief gusty winds (generally <25 kt) possible as the weakening remnant low passes inland late week
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Virginia coast for this event
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of moderate rain (1â€“2 in.) possible Friday as the remnant low moves offshore
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor river or urban ponding possible but no significant operational hazards anticipated
